Class DatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
DatabaseManager
public class DatabaseManager extends Object
Dominick Vician, CEN-3024C-24204, April 1st, 2025 DatabaseManager.java This class is responsible for managing connections to the MySQL database, ensuring that the vehicles table exists, and providing methods to load and save vehicle data. It handles direct database operations such as creating the table, retrieving all vehicle records, and synchronizing in-memory data with the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • DatabaseManager

      public DatabaseManager() throws SQLException
      Constructs a new DatabaseManager object. This constructor loads the MySQL JDBC driver, builds the connection URL using the configured static fields, establishes a connection, and ensures that the vehicles table exists by creating it if necessary.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the JDBC driver is not found.

  • Method Details

    • createTableIfNotExists

      private void createTableIfNotExists() throws SQLException
      Creates the vehicles table in the database if it does not already exist.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • addVehicle

      public boolean addVehicle(Vehicle vehicle) throws SQLException
      Inserts a vehicle record into the database.
      Parameters:
      vehicle - The specified vehicle object to add.
      Returns:
      true if the vehicle was added successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • removeVehicle

      public boolean removeVehicle(int vin) throws SQLException
      Removes a vehicle record from the database.
      Parameters:
      vin - The VIN of the vehicle to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the vehicle was removed successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • updateVehicle

      public boolean updateVehicle(Vehicle vehicle) throws SQLException
      Updates a vehicle record in the database.
      Parameters:
      vehicle - The vehicle object to be updated
      Returns:
      true if the vehicle was updated successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • getAllVehicles

      public List<Vehicle> getAllVehicles() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all vehicle records from the database.
      Returns:
      a List of Vehicle objects representing all vehicles in the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • computeCurrentPrice

      public Double computeCurrentPrice(int vin, double depRate, int currentYear) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the vehicle with the specified VIN and computes its current price using the depreciation formula.
      Parameters:
      vin - An integer representing the Vehicle Identification Number.
      depRate - A double representing the depreciation rate (e.g., 0.1 for 10%).
      currentYear - An int representing the current year.
      Returns:
      The computed current price if successful, or null if the vehicle is not found or an error occurs.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • close

      public void close() throws SQLException
      Closes the connection to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
